# Questions{1/17}

## Q 1
###a

$$
\begin{align}
P(Expert \, did \, not \, identify| Matched \,Prints)&=1-P(Expert\, Identify|Matched \,prints)\\
&=1-0.9212 \\
&= 0.0788 \\
&= 7.88\%
\end{align}
$$

###b
$$
\begin{align}
P(Novice \, will \, not \, identify| Matched \,Prints)&=1-P(Novice\, Identify|Matched\, prints)\\
&=1-0.7455 \\
&= 0.2545 \\
&= 25.45\%
\end{align}
$$

###c
Since, Novice has higher probability of failing to identifying the matched prints. It is possible that it will most likely be a novice that fails to identify the matched prints.
